column4: I made a script that i start from an icon on the desktop but the terminal that is opened doesn't show any output. The program is running though.
Is there a switch i can add to the commandline or something?
does xterm run ok?
read /var/log/dpkg.log
is it doing something right now?
I don't know what you mean. It has 4 bashes ran, wich have launched processes that run under python or mono.
if you close the terminal, the child processes will die
This is bad because all opened terminals will die
If i do a shutdown, will it do it gracefully you think?
should do, yes
I'd do it manually, just to be sure
could try it from xterm, see if it is a bug
close down the apps etc
i see 'end process' in the system monitor, is that what you mean?
kill the process is all I can suggest

It already all died when the term i closed brought up a kill dialog that was for the gnome-terminal and not for itself. And presto.. all terminals gone in one foul swoop. All processes dead. Problem solved, patient dead.
as good as can be expected
True. Doesn't mean i'm happy about it though :)

One final question. If i had been running all processes under screen, would after this kill the screen and processes udner screen survived or would they too have been taken down by killing of Gnome-terminal?
i'd ask in #vbox too
if you set it in compiz shortcuts to run something pointless, it should do it, not sure about terminal etc
is the samba package installed?
apt-cache policy samba    will show you
yes it is installed
and you cannot unshare the folder now, is that right?
Yes. If i go to sharing options i can choose to share it again. It is already shared, i want to unshare it.
tried sharing it again then unsharing it?
NO, i will try that
all ok now?
yay, nice guess
I use smb.conf for samba. Its super easy
I manage my fileserver via ssh, so config files are the way, its not a complex file :)
should just work tbh
depends
there should be an icon the the bottom left
its not going to, if the video hardware isn't up to 3D, it will use the CPU
Yes the icon is there, But i want more than 4
you can set it in ccsm, i believe 2d obeys that setting
Pretend i am a moron. ccsp?
ccsm    compiz settings manager
what do you do once you connect via vnc anyway?
graphical apps like what?
try a lighter desktop, like LXDE or XFCE
i prefer vanilla in case of updates and migrations
you can use a web browser via SSH X forwarding
blocked by whom?
who is blocking ssh?
are you connecting to vnc over www?
